title: How to Snack Healthily

steps.headline: Decide that you want to have a healthy approach to eating.
steps.description: That will put snacks in the proper place. This is half the battle. If you are prone to unhealthy snacking it is usually because you are trying to substitute snack foods for solid and satisfying meals.

steps.headline: Plan your healthy approach around lean protein, fruits and veggies, and whole grains with healthy fats like olive oil and nuts.
steps.description: Eating these foods in portions about the size and thickness of your palm will assure that your hunger and appetite are being met.

steps.headline: Revise your plan if you are still finding yourself snacking.
steps.description: Add more fruits and veggies. Break out of your comfort zone and try fresh fruit you don't usually buy. Add seasoning like lemon pepper, ginger or garlic to steamed vegetables. Dress up eggs with fresh salsa and lots of it.

steps.headline: Choose snacks from your same menu.
steps.description: This becomes easier once you have established the foods that are actually beneficial to your health. As you consume these foods, your taste will change and suddenly that vinegar on your romaine salad will be yummy.

steps.headline: If necessary, abstain from those foods that are causing you to stray from healthy eating.
steps.description: Try it for one day. If you feel better and find it easier to abstain rather than have small portions of junk food, then add another day. If you still feel better, keep going.

steps.headline: There are also very many naturally made chips and other various foods that are delicious.
steps.description: The key is to regard a snack as another meal and not some separate activity.

steps.headline: There are plenty of healthy snacks.
steps.description: Try mixing different berries and fruits together. Learn healthy substitutes for unhealthy ingredients, for example, apple juice (or apples) make great substitute for sugar. Learn the healthier ingredients and make your own snack. There are many healthy snack recipes out there.

steps.headline: Don't give up.
steps.description: If you feel like you can't survive with chocolate or potato chips, try eating fruits whenever you are hungry - don't overeat -if you survive a few days without unhealthy snacks, you won't feel the need to have it anymore.

steps.headline: Pack little containers full of 100-200 calories worth of fruits.
steps.description: If your hungry, have these around the house or take them to work, school or on the go.

steps.headline: Snack on things that have a low calorie content, for example, pears.

text: Decide that you want to have a healthy approach to eating. That will put snacks in the proper place. This is half the battle. If you are prone to unhealthy snacking it is usually because you are trying to substitute snack foods for solid and satisfying meals. Plan your healthy approach around lean protein, fruits and veggies, and whole grains with healthy fats like olive oil and nuts. Eating these foods in portions about the size and thickness of your palm will assure that your hunger and appetite are being met. Revise your plan if you are still finding yourself snacking. Add more fruits and veggies. Break out of your comfort zone and try fresh fruit you don't usually buy. Add seasoning like lemon pepper, ginger or garlic to steamed vegetables. Dress up eggs with fresh salsa and lots of it. Choose snacks from your same menu. This becomes easier once you have established the foods that are actually beneficial to your health. As you consume these foods, your taste will change and suddenly that vinegar on your romaine salad will be yummy. If necessary, abstain from those foods that are causing you to stray from healthy eating. Try it for one day. If you feel better and find it easier to abstain rather than have small portions of junk food, then add another day. If you still feel better, keep going. There are also very many naturally made chips and other various foods that are delicious. The key is to regard a snack as another meal and not some separate activity. There are plenty of healthy snacks. Try mixing different berries and fruits together. Learn healthy substitutes for unhealthy ingredients, for example, apple juice (or apples) make great substitute for sugar. Learn the healthier ingredients and make your own snack. There are many healthy snack recipes out there. Don't give up. If you feel like you can't survive with chocolate or potato chips, try eating fruits whenever you are hungry - don't overeat -if you survive a few days without unhealthy snacks, you won't feel the need to have it anymore. Pack little containers full of 100-200 calories worth of fruits. If your hungry, have these around the house or take them to work, school or on the go. Snack on things that have a low calorie content, for example, pears.
